pullRequest.title: Prevent to remove last owner
pullRequest.bodyText:
Motivation
The backend provides us with a validation which ensures that the last owner can't be removed.
Description

Extend EntityShareState value class for ValidationResults
Add new component which will display the ValidationResult if the validation failed
Disable the submit button if the Validation `failed.

Fixes #8841
/jenkins-pr-deps Graylog2/graylog-plugin-enterprise#1569

nodes.bodyText: This results in an eslint warning regarding the empty line between import statements + another one for the quotes.
All four eslint-disable-next-line no-undef comments are not necessary in for these cases.

We could structure this message similar to the dependency warning:
  • Removing the following owners will leave the entity ownerless:
    {pastOwners.map((owner, key) => ( {_cap(owner.type)} {owner.title} {key !== pasOwners.size - 1 && ', '} ))}
    • pastOwners is an array of Grantees in this case. This way the message is still readable, even if there are many previous owners, the owner names can be identified easier, because of the and it is consistent compared with the dependency warning.
.toJS() is not necessary in this case.

commit.message:
Add new SelectedGranteeValidation

## Motivation
Prior to this change, we could not check if the
SelectedGranteeCapabilities were valid. But it is not allowed to remove
the last owner.

## Description
This change adds a function to validate the SelectedGranteeCapabilities.
Use backend validation instead of creating on in frontend
Disable Submit button and add test
